hints.content: Start by understanding the goal of the problem. You need to perform operations to make all elements in the array equal. Consider what kind of operations you can perform and how they affect the elements.
Think about what it means to make all elements equal. If you can only increase or decrease the values, what would be the best target value to minimize the number of operations?
Consider the median of the array. The median minimizes the sum of absolute differences, which is likely to be relevant here. How can you find the median in an unsorted array?

When calculating the total operations needed, remember to consider both increasing and decreasing values. How would you calculate the number of operations for a single element compared to the target value?
Make sure to handle edge cases, such as when the array has only one element. What would be the output in that case, and why?
Think about how the operations scale with larger arrays. Would sorting the array help you find the median or target value more efficiently?
Consider implementing a function to calculate the total number of operations needed for a given target. This will help you test different potential target values systematically.
What happens if all elements are already equal? Ensure your solution can handle this case efficiently without unnecessary calculations.
When implementing your solution, pay attention to the return format. What should your function return? Is it a single integer representing the total operations?
As you finalize your approach, think about the time complexity of your solution. How efficient is your method for finding the median and calculating operations in terms of big O notation?

questionNotes: You need to make all elements in the array equal using the minimum number of operations.
You can only increase or decrease the values of the elements.
The target value to minimize operations is likely the median of the array.
Consider edge cases like an array with a single element or all elements being equal.
The function should return a single integer representing the total number of operations.
